prereq.p: This recipe will make 6 eight-inch waffles.

This recipe calls for white whole wheat flour, which bakes and tastes more like all-purpose flour. If you like wheaty tasting waffles, you can also use whole wheat pastry flour. But if you’d rather use all-purpose, then go ahead! Both are on top of my refrigerator.

step.cmd: Turn the waffle maker on to allow it to preheat. For a golden brown waffle, Setting 3 is recommended.
Sift flour, baking powder, salt and allspice into a mixing bowl. Mix in the oats.
Make a well in the center and add applesauce, milk, maple syrup, oil and vanilla. Stir until combined.
Let batter rest for 5 minutes or so, it will thicken a bit. Fold in the blueberries. Don’t worry if the blueberries bleed into the batter, it’s no biggie.
Pour batter into waffle maker. I typically use 1/2 cup of batter per waffle. Remember to coat machine with oil in between every waffle.
Take waffle out when it is cooked how you prefer. (Around 5 minutes) Pour maple syrup on top and enjoy!
